page.title: 13Language in Caerhun Parish
page.content: Welsh is the language of this area. Many English people live here so English is widely spoken but Welsh language classes are well-attended. The Welsh language and culture has revived lately. All are encouraged to speak their native tongue and the minutes of local council meetings are kept in Welsh. Rowen village derives its name from the white gravel carried down from the hills by the River Ro: gravel - 'Gro', mutated to 'Ro'; white - 'Gwyn', mutated and in its feminine form 'Wen': hence 'Rowen'.The names of some farmsteads are historical e.g. 'Tyddyn Du', a black cottage built and its land pegged out in one day. 'Maen y Bardd' means Pillar of the Bard. Bryn Cynhadledd or Hill of Conference is an open meeting place which possibly dates back to prehistoric times.
